column5: I’m so sorry that your husband is struggling so deeply and that you are also suffering. You are important too. He’s getting help, and you should too. If you have access to therapy, I highly recommend. Boundaries are life saving and you can’t love him and be there for him if you’re depleted! NAMI also has support groups for family members of mentally ill people and I think you could potentially find great hope and comfort in that as well. https://www.nami.org/Support-Education/Support-Groups/NAMI-Family-Support-Group
Wow I thought I was the only one who felt this way. I can’t tell if it’s because of the weed consumption or the depression, I guess it’s both.
